com.fizzikgames.fizlib.pathfinding

Class Astar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fizzikgames.fizlib.pathfinding.Astar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Astar
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Astar pathfinder will implement the Astar algorithm to find the most ideal path from a starting position to an ending position. Only one Astar pathfinder needs to be created for every Map, and can then be used to calculate paths for multiple movers.
    Version:
    1.02
    Author:
    Maxim Tiourin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Astar(AstarHeuristic aHeuristic, TileMap aMap, int anOpenListSize, int aSearchRange, boolean allowDiagonal, boolean allowDiagonalClip, boolean allowVertical)
      Initializes the Astar pathfinder for a specific Tilemap and heuristic, with specific flags on whether to allow diagonal and vertical movement (in case of z levels).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Astar

        public Astar(AstarHeuristic aHeuristic,
     TileMap aMap,
     int anOpenListSize,
     int aSearchRange,
     boolean allowDiagonal,
     boolean allowDiagonalClip,
     boolean allowVertical)
        Initializes the Astar pathfinder for a specific Tilemap and heuristic, with specific flags on whether to allow diagonal and vertical movement (in case of z levels). It also asks you for an open list size value so that it can immediately allocate that much memory for the Binary Heap instead of starting with a small value, and then having to reallocate constantly, so choose a value you think will be best suited for your map size.
        Parameters:
        aHeuristic - The heuristic to use when calculating the paths
        aMap - The TileMap to use to look up movementCosts when calculating paths
        anOpenListSize - The initial open list size, larger values save time if you expect lots of tiles to be searched
        aSearchRange - The maximum amount of nodes to search before giving up, a value of 0 means no limit.
        allowDiagonal - Whether or not to allow diagonal movement checks on the same z level
        allowDiagonalClip - Whether or not to allow clipping through corners if diagonal movement is enabled.
        allowVertical - Whether or not to allow vertical movement checks above and below 1 z level

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:

      • findPath

        public Path findPath(Mover mover,
            Node aStartNode,
            Node aDestNode)
        Finds and returns the optimal path from startNode to destNode if one exists, accounting for movement costs based on the mover's moveCosts and heuristic costs for the nodes.
        Parameters:
        mover - object that will help determine movement costs
        aStartNode - starting node
        aDestNode - destination node
        Returns:
        path

        public boolean isSearchingDiagonally()
        Returns whether or not the pathfinder is allowed to search diagonally on the same z-level.
        Returns:
        boolean of diagonal search permission

      • setSearchingDiagonally

        Set whether or not the pathfinder is allowed to search diagonally on the same z-level.
        Parameters:
        b - boolean

      • isSearchingVertically

        public boolean isSearchingVertically()
        Returns whether or not the pathfinder is allowed to search vertically above and below 1 z-level. (Does not do diagonal/adjacent vertical checks)
        Returns:
        boolean of vertical search permission

      • setSearchingVertically

        public void setSearchingVertically(boolean b)
        Set whether or not the pathfinder is allowed to search vetically above and below 1 z-level. (Does not do diagonal/adjacent vertical checks)
        Parameters:
        b - boolean
